detaileddescription.para: The experiment this model is connected to.
The map with all entities and their identifiers.
The current number of the created entities.
Dynamic List containing all associated submodels.
Dynamic List containing all reportable components of this model.
The parameter manager
True if this is the main model (not a submodel to another model), false for submodels.

memberdef.argsstring: (Model owner, String name, boolean showInReport, boolean showInTrace)
memberdef.name: Model

detaileddescription.para: Constructs a model, with the given name and parameters for report and trace files.

parameterdescription.para: java.lang.String : The name of this model
Model : The main model this model is associated to
boolean : Flag for showing this model in trace-files. Set it to true if model should show up in trace, false if model should not be shown in trace.

detaileddescription.para: Connects this model to an experiment. The given experiment must not already be connected to some other model. Otherwise an errormessage will be given and the experiment will be stopped. Since a model that is not yet connected has no access to the experiment's messaging subsystem,

Creates the default reporter associated with this model. The default reporter returned by this method just prints the model's description as implemented in method description() and appends the simulation time of the last reset. If the user's model offers more information, create a special class derived from class desmoj.report.ModelReporter to extract and present that extra information.

simplesect.para: Reportable : The reporter associated with this model

detaileddescription.para: Should return the description of the model. Implement this method to document the model's intent, creator, date and all other information that needs to be published about this model in a report. Please use it generously, other people interested in your model will thank you.

simplesect.para: java.lang.String : The description of the model as a text String

detaileddescription.para: Implement this method to schedule the entities and/or events needed for your model to start in a defined setting. If a model is connected to an experiment and started without any initial schedules, it will not run since no events to process are on the scheduler's event-list. This method is called automatically by the framework when the experiment's start() method is called.

Returns the entity to the belonging identifier.
Entity : The class will return the Entity or null if no such exists.
Returns a list of this model's entities.

parameterdescription.para: boolean : Do include (true) or exclude (false) submodels' entities in the list.

simplesect.para: List<Entity> : The class will return a list of all existing objects of Entity or null if no list exists.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the experiment that is connected to this model or null if the model is not yet connected to an experiment.

simplesect.para: Experiment : The experiment that this model is connected to or null if no connection is established

detaileddescription.para: Returns a copy of the dynamic list containing all reportable components of this model.

simplesect.para: reportables : A list containing all reportable components of this model.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the Model's viewpoint of the ParameterManager
Shows, if there are submodels registered with this model.

simplesect.para: boolean : True, if there is at least one submodel registered at this Model, flase if there are no submodels

detaileddescription.para: Implement this method to do initialization work for your model. All ModelComponents associated with this model are supposed to be instantiated in this method.

Caution! Do not use the Model's constructor method to instantiate your modelcomponents! This prevents the modelcomponents to get contact to the associated Experiment since a Model can only be connected to an Experiment after itself has been instantiated correctly. Thus it is necessary to put all initialization and instantiation work into this method. Do not use this method to do the initial schedules needed for the scheduler to start with. Use method doInitialSchedules() instead. If there are no events scheduled in the event-list, the scheduler will stop the simulation immediately because there is nothing for him to do. If you are using submodels, take care that each of the submodels has its own init method properly set up.

Initializes the model by calling method init() to set up all model related components as specified in that method. After initializing the model, the given ModelOption's setOption() method is called with this model as parameter. This enables the user to specify different model parameter settings for different experiments. It even allows automated parameter variation to give a small but handy aid for model optimization. Implement the ModelOptions to set the parameters for your model. Make sure to react properly on the ModelOptions given. Note that specifiying ModelOptions is up to the user.

parameterdescription.para: ModelOptions : The parameter settings for this model

detaileddescription.para: Shows if this model has already been connected to an experiment.

simplesect.para: boolean : Is true, if model is connected to an experiment, false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Shows if this model is a main model and thus is not submodel of other models.

simplesect.para: boolean : Returns true if the model is a main model, false if it is a submodel of other models

detaileddescription.para: Shows if this model is submodel to another model and thus is not the main models.

simplesect.para: boolean : Returns true if the model is a submodel of other models, false if it is a main model

detaileddescription.para: Registers a reportable at this model. Reports can only be drawn, if the reportbale is registered at his model.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.core.simulator.Reportable : The reportable to be registered

detaileddescription.para: Resets the statistic counters of this model and of all its registered reportables. Also calls all submodels's reset() methods.

Checks the given modelcomponent for compatibility. Needed exclusively when submodels are present that want to share modelcomponents between them. The standard implementation only checks if the modelcomponent other belongs to this model. For use with multiple models, the user has to specify which other models are compatible to this model by overloading this method.

simplesect.para: boolean : Returns true if the given modelcomponent is compatible to this model, false otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: ModelComponent : The modelcomponent that needs to be checked for compatibility to this model.

detaileddescription.para: Calls the init() method of all registered submodels of the current model. Subsequently calls the init() method of all registered submodels of every submodel.
Calls the doInitialSchedules() method of all registered submodels of the current model. Subsequently calls the doSubmodelSchedules() method of all registered submodels of every submodel.
Links an entity with an unique identification number.

parameterdescription.para: Entity : The new Entity to link with an unique identification number.

detaileddescription.para: Registers another model as submodel of this model.

parameterdescription.para: Model : The model to be registerd as a submodel

detaileddescription.para: Produces a report about the model and all its related modelcomponents and submodels. It registers the model's reporter and all other reporters at the experiment's reportmanager to produce the report output. The reporters are ordered into the reportmanager returned with this model's reporter first, followed by all reportable's reporters. After this section, all submodel's reporters are inserted according to the order they were attached to this model. Each submodel's section is sorted using the criteria above. Thus all reporters a re separated by model to prevent confusion.

simplesect.para: Enumeration : The Enumeration carrying all reporters available from this model

detaileddescription.para: Connects submodels to the experiment given. This method is called by the main model, when submodels register themselves at the main model.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.Experiment : The experiment to connect this model to

detaileddescription.para: Sets the current model to be the main model by setting the owner reference to itself.

The model is supposed to carry references to all static modelcomponents associated to a model. These are modelcomponents like distributions and statistic counters. Note that placing all essential components inside the model class allows you to use object orientation to reuse this model to implement different versions of it using subclassing for changes necessary for using other modelling paradigms. This way models can be easily reimplemented following the process-, event-, transaction- or activity- oriented paradigm. Note that transaction- and activity-oriented modelling requires the higher process synchronization mechanisms (Res, Bin, WaitQueue, CondQueue) by Soenke Claassen.

The modelcomponents belonging to a model have to be instantiated in the init() method. They must not be instantiated in the model's constructor since most components need access to a valid experiment object. This can only be accessed after a model has been connected to an experiment using method connectToExperiment(Experiment exp) which implicitly calls the init() method after receiving the valid reference to an experiment.
